intro: Philippia pilulifera, commonly known as the bead-leaved philippia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, bead-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky habitats and is adapted to dry conditions. Philippia pilulifera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and compact growth habit.
